rules: Rule1: Provided that the lab completes testing, then if the drug is not successful, the agency investigates the drug.
Rule2: The drug is effective or the drug is profitable.
Rule3: In the event that the drug is profitable, the drug is successful.
Rule4: Assuming the drug is approved, then if the drug is effective, the drug is safe.
Rule5: Should the drug pass trial1, then the drug is approved.
Rule6: Either the drug passes trial1 or the drug passes trial2.
Rule7: Provided that the drug passes trial2, it passes trial3.
Rule8: If the drug passes trial3, then the drug is approved.
Rule9: Whenever the lab tests the drug, then if the company develops the drug, the drug is successful.

Rule10: The process accelerates the drug or the process resumes the drug or the process halts the drug or, in the event that the company considers production, then either the agency approves the drug or the lab tests the drug.
Rule11: If the drug meets standard1, then the agency approves the drug.
Rule12: Should the drug meet standard2, then the lab tests the drug.
Rule13: Provided that the agency evaluates safety, then either the drug meets standard1 or the drug meets standard2.
Rule14: The agency evaluates safety or the agency evaluates efficacy.
Rule15: Whenever the agency evaluates efficacy, it follows that either the drug meets standard1 or the drug meets standard2.
Rule16: Either the review expedites the process or, if the agency requires testing, then the lab completes testing.
Rule17: Assuming the review is standard for the process, then it is not the case that the review expedites the process.
Rule18: If the drug qualifies for category1, then it qualifies for category2.
Rule19: Given that the company patents the drug, it licenses the drug.
Rule20: Provided that the agency monitors the drug, then if the company licenses the drug, the drug is approved.
Rule21: In cases where the company markets the drug, then if it is not the case that either the agency approves the drug or the lab tests the drug, the company recalls the drug.
Rule22: Assuming the company submits the application, then if the drug is not successful, the agency investigates the drug.
Rule23: Either the company submits the application or the agency reviews the application.
Rule24: Should the agency review the application, then the agency requires testing.
Rule25: Given that the agency requires testing, the results validate testing.
Rule26: If it is not the case that if the results validate testing then the lab completes testing, then the results invalidate testing.
Rule27: In cases where it is not the case that either the agency approves the drug or the lab tests the drug, it is not the case that the company recalls the drug.
Rule28: Should it not be the case that if the drug qualifies for category2 then the drug is approved, then the drug disqualifies for the category.
Rule29: Assuming it is not the case that if the drug qualifies for category2 then the drug is approved, then it is not the case that the drug disqualifies for the category.
Rule30: Provided that it is not the case that if the agency requires testing then the lab completes testing, then the process delays the drug.
Rule31: In the event that it is not the case that if the agency requires testing then the lab completes testing, then it is not the case that the process delays the drug.
facts: Fact1: The company develops the drug.
Fact3: The review is standard for the process.
Fact4: The drug qualifies for category1.
Fact5: The company patents the drug.
Fact6: The agency monitors the drug.
Fact7: The company markets the drug.
Fact8: It is not the case that the drug is safe.
Fact9: It is not the case that the process halts the drug.
Fact10: It is not the case that the process resumes the drug.
Fact11: It is not the case that the process accelerates the drug.
Fact12: It is not the case that the results invalidate testing.
Fact13: It is not the case that the agency approves the drug.
Fact14: It is not the case that the agency investigates the drug.
